sen.j: 木内 峰太（きうち みねた、生没年不詳）は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Mineta KIUCHI (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a Tokugawa shogunate police force located in Kyoto).
Mineta KIUCHI (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a Tokugawa shogunate police force located in Kyoto).
Mineta KIUCHI (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a Tokugawa shogunate police force located in Kyoto).

sen.j: 島田魁によれば、近江国の出身。
sen.e: According to Kai SHIMADA, he was from Omi Province.
According to Kai SHIMADA, he was from Omi Province.
According to Kai SHIMADA, he was from Omi Province.

sen.j: 名の読みはほうたとも。
sen.e: His name is also pronounced as Hota.
His name is also pronounced as Hota.
His name is also pronounced as Hota.
His name is written as 峰太 in Japanese, but it is also sometimes written as 峯太 or 岸太.
His name is written as 峰太 in Japanese, but it is also sometimes written as 峯太 or 岸太.
His name is written as 峰太 in Japanese, but it is also sometimes written as 峯太 or 岸太.

sen.j: 新選組入隊は文久3年7月頃。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi in around August 1863.
He joined the Shinsengumi around August 1863.
sen.cmt: 不要な箇所を削除しました。
sen.e: He joined the Shinsengumi around August 1863.

sen.j: 元治元年6月5日の池田屋事件では土方歳三の隊（松原忠司、井上源三郎の隊とも）に所属し、屋外の守備を行っていた。
sen.e: When the Ikedaya Incident occurred on July 8, 1864, he was a member of Toshizo HIJIKATA's team (some people think he was in Chuji MATSUBARA's team or Genzaburo INOUE's team), and he took charge of outdoor defense.

When the Ikedaya Incident occurred on July 8, 1864, he was a member of Toshizo HIJIKATA's team (some people think he was in Chuji MATSUBARA's team or Genzaburo INOUE's team), and he was in charge of outdoor defense.
sen.cmt: he was in chargeの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: When the Ikedaya Incident occurred on July 8, 1864, he was a member of Toshizo HIJIKATA's team (some people think he was in Chuji MATSUBARA's team or Genzaburo INOUE's team), and he was in charge of outdoor defense.

sen.j: 後に十五両の褒賞金を得ている。
sen.e: He was granted an award of 15 ryo afterward.
He was granted an award of 15 ryo afterwards.
He was granted an award of 15 ryo afterwards.

sen.j: 同年の12月に行われた編成では伊東甲子太郎の二番組に所属している。
sen.e: He entered the Nibangumi (Second Unit) led by Kashitaro ITO when the Shinsengumi was reorganized in December 1864.
He entered the Nibangumi (Second Unit) led by Kashitaro ITO when the Shinsengumi was reorganized in December 1864.
He entered the Nibangumi (Second Unit) led by Kashitaro ITO when the Shinsengumi was reorganized in December 1864.

sen.j: 慶応3年6月10日の幕府召抱えでは、平同士として名がある。
sen.e: When the Tokugawa shogunate employed samurai on July 11, 1867, he was also employed as a hidadoshi (regimental soldier).
When the Tokugawa shogunate employed samurai on July 11, 1867, he was also employed as a hidadoshi (regimental soldier).
When the Tokugawa shogunate employed samurai on July 11, 1867, he was also employed as a hidadoshi (regimental soldier).

sen.j: しかし、同年12月迄に離隊している。
sen.e: However, he left the corps no later than December 1867.
However, he left the corps no later than December 1867.
However, he left the corps no later than December 1867.

sen.j: 明治8年には京都で警察官に採用されたという逸話が残っている。
sen.e: An anecdote has it that he became a policeman in Kyoto in 1875.
An anecdote has it that he became a policeman in Kyoto in 1875.
An anecdote has it that he became a policeman in Kyoto in 1875.
